meanings.definition: A diagrammatic representation of a family tree.
meanings.sent1: The stemma showed all the relatives in our family tree.
meanings.sent2: I used the stemma to trace my ancestry back to the 1800s.
meanings.sent3: The stemma made it look like our family tree was growing right out of the paper!
meanings.sent4: Heritage is like a colorful stemma, with each branch representing a different generation.
meanings.sent5: The stemma was so detailed, it felt like I could almost see my ancestors standing there.

meanings.definition: The main stem of a plant or tree.
meanings.sent1: The stemma of the oak tree was thick and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: I carefully pruned the stemma to encourage new growth.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the stemma as a highway to reach the ripe acorns.
meanings.sent4: The stemma of the rose bush stood tall, supporting the beautiful blooms.
meanings.sent5: The stemma of the palm tree swayed gently in the breeze, a symbol of resilience.

meanings.definition: A supporting structure in a building or ship.
meanings.sent1: The stemma of the ship kept it upright in rough seas.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a strong stemma for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The stemma of the house creaked under the weight of the heavy snow.
meanings.sent4: The stemma of the bridge spanned the river like a giant's hand.
meanings.sent5: The stemma of the skyscraper reached high into the sky, a testament to human engineering.
